title: British industrial regions suffer ‘gene drain’ with the healthier and more learned moving away
text:
Britain’s traditional industrial regions have suffered a ‘gene drain’ with people who are healthier and achieve more academically leaving for urban centres such as London, a new study has shown.

Major research which plotted the movement and DNA of around 450,000 people enrolled in the UK Biobank, which has been recording the genetic data of Britons since 2006.

Scientists discovered that social migration, where people leave their home towns to live, study and work elsewhere, has dramatically changed the geographic distribution of genetic traits.
